decision_conditions: The proposed layout of the development would be inadequate resulting in substandard accommodation for future residents through lack of internal space, poor outlook, limited light, noise and disturbance from pedestrian and vehicular movements detrimental to future residential amenity and contrary to Policies DC4 and DC61 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, Policy 3.5 of the London Plan the DCLG Technical Housing Standards March 2015, and as amended, and the London Borough of Havering Residential Design SPD 2011.

The proposed development would, by reason of the inadequate provision of amenity space, result in a cramped over-development of the site to the detriment of future occupiers contrary to Policy DC61 of the  London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and the  London Borough of Havering Residential Design SPD 2011.

The proposed development would, by reason of the inadequate on site cycle parking provision, result in decreased amenity to residents through lack of dedicated storage space or further reliance on motorised transport contrary to  Policy DC35 of the  London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008, and Policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2016

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent in writing 05/06/2019.
description: The proposal is for the alteration at rear of property to create a studio flat.
